1:
Yahweh, commander of the angel armies,\q2 your temple is very beautiful!
\q1
2:
I would like to be there;\q2 Yahweh, I desire that very much.
\q2 With all my inner being I sing joyfully to you, the all-powerful God.



\q1
3:
Even sparrows and swallows have built nests near your temple;\q2 they take care of their young babies near the altars where people offer sacrifices to you,
\q2 Commander of the angel armies, my king and my God.
\q1
4:
How fortunate are those who are always in your temple,\q2 constantly singing to praise you.



\q1
5:
How fortunate are those whom you make strong,\q1 those who desire very much to make the trip up to Mount Zion.
\q1
6:
While they travel through the dryValley of Tears,\q1 you cause it to become a place where there are springs of water,
\q2 where the rains in the autumn fill the valley with water, a blessing from you.


\q1
7:
As a result, those who travel through there become stronger\q2 knowing that they will appear in your presence on Mount Zion.
\q1
8:
Yahweh, commander of the angel armies, listen to my prayer;\q1 God, whom we descendants of Jacob worship, hear what I am saying!
\q1
9:
God, act kindly toward our king, the one who protects us,\q2 the one whom you have chosen to rule us.
\q1
10:
For me, spending one day in your temple\q2 is better than spending a thousand days somewhere else;
\q1 standing at the entrance to your temple, ready to go inside,
\q2 is better than living in the tents where wicked people live.


\q1
11:
Yahweh our God is like the sun that shines on us and like a shield that protects us;\q2 he acts favorably toward us and honors us.
\q1 Yahweh does not refuse to give any good thing to those who do what is right.
\q1
12: Yahweh, commander of the angel armies,\q2 how fortunate are those who trust in you!
